Covers common patterns like combineLatest, switchMap, debounceTime, catchError, retry logic, and integration with Angular Signals using toSignal() and toObservable(). Ensures proper subscription cleanup with takeUntilDestroyed().

content.value_statement: Angular developers struggle with complex reactive programming patterns and memory leaks from improper subscription management. This skill provides ready-to-use code examples and best practices for RxJS operators, Angular Signals integration, and proper cleanup with takeUntilDestroyed().
actual_capabilities: Provide RxJS operator examples (switchMap, mergeMap, debounceTime, combineLatest)
Show Angular Signals integration with toSignal() and toObservable()
Demonstrate proper subscription cleanup using takeUntilDestroyed()
Explain error handling patterns with catchError and retry logic
Share real-time data patterns with WebSocket and polling
Guide on loading states and shareReplay caching
limitations: Does not execute or test code - only provides documentation and examples
Does not access user projects or modify files
Cannot install or configure RxJS dependencies
Assumes basic understanding of TypeScript and Angular concepts

output: Use switchMap to cancel previous requests when the search query changes
Combine with debounceTime to wait for user to stop typing
This ensures only the latest query triggers a request

best_practices: Always use takeUntilDestroyed() for subscription cleanup in Angular components
Prefer toSignal() over manual subscriptions for template data binding
Use switchMap for user-triggered requests to cancel stale API calls
anti_patterns: Avoid nested subscriptions - use operators like switchMap instead
Do not forget to unsubscribe - memory leaks will occur
Avoid mixing AsyncPipe with Signals - choose one approach

faq.question: What Angular versions support takeUntilDestroyed()?
faq.answer: takeUntilDestroyed() is available in Angular 16+ via @angular/core/rxjs-interop

faq.question: What is the difference between switchMap and mergeMap?
faq.answer: switchMap cancels previous requests, mergeMap runs them in parallel, concatMap runs them sequentially

faq.question: How do I combine multiple Observables?
faq.answer: Use combineLatest for latest values from all, forkJoin for when all complete, or merge to combine streams

faq.question: Is this skill safe to use with sensitive data?
faq.answer: Yes - this is a read-only documentation skill that does not access files, network, or execute code

faq.question: Why are my RxJS subscriptions causing memory leaks?
faq.answer: You are likely not cleaning up subscriptions. Use takeUntilDestroyed() or unsubscribe in ngOnDestroy

faq.question: Should I use Signals or RxJS Observables?
faq.answer: Use Signals for synchronous state, Observables for async operations. Combine both using toSignal() and toObservable()
